8 IntensityCueManager::IntensityCueManager(ros::NodeHandle n,
9  const std::string sub_topic,
10  const std::string pub_topic,
11  const std::string method,
12  const bool video
13  ){
14  this->video = video; // Display boolean
15 
16  // Determine which callback function this class instance should use.
17  if (method == "bv") {
18  imageCallback = &IntensityCueManager::brightestVectorCallback;
19  } else if (method == "cv") {
20  imageCallback = &IntensityCueManager::centroidVectorCallback;
21  } else {
22  ROS_ERROR("Unrecognised cue type %s", method.c_str());
23  ROS_INFO("Supported reference methods: bv, cv");
24  exit(-1);
25  }
26 
27  // Plumb up the ROS subscriber and publisher
28  it = new image_transport::ImageTransport(n);
29  pub = n.advertise<bb_computation::cue_vector>(pub_topic, 1000);
30  sub =
31  it->subscribe(sub_topic, 1, IntensityCueManager::imageCallback, this);
32 
33 }
34

36 IntensityCueManager::~IntensityCueManager(){
37  delete it;
38 }

41 //
42 // IMAGE CALLBACK FUNCTIONS
43 //
44 
45 //
46 // Compute a cue as the vector from the centre of the image to the brightest
47 // point in the image.
48 //
49 void IntensityCueManager::brightestVectorCallback(
50  const sensor_msgs::ImageConstPtr& msg
51  ){
52  cv::Mat frame;
53 
54  try{
55  frame = cv_bridge::toCvCopy(msg, "mono8")->image;
56  } catch (cv_bridge::Exception &e){
57  ROS_ERROR("cv_bridge error: %s", e.what());
58  ROS_INFO("This node should be subscribed to a "
59  "topic producing grayscale (mono8) images");
60  }
61 
62  double minVal=0, maxVal=0;
63  cv::Point minLoc, maxLoc;
64 
65  //Find brightest point and mark - Note if this isn't working well
66  //try enabling gaussian smoothing.
67  cv::minMaxLoc(frame, &maxVal, &maxVal, &minLoc, &maxLoc);
68 
69  const cv::Mat& frame_ref = frame;
70  Cue cue(maxLoc, frame_ref);
71 
72  if (this->video){
73  ROS_INFO("Cue, (direction, magnitude): (%lf, %lf)",
74  cue.direction(),
75  cue.strength());
76 
77  // Mark brightest point on the frame for printing
78  cv::Mat& colour_frame = cue.drawCueVectorOnFrame(frame);
79  bb_util::vision::imshow("Brightest point", colour_frame);
80  }
81 
82  this->pub.publish(cue.toMessage());
83 }
84 
85 void IntensityCueManager::centroidVectorCallback(
86  const sensor_msgs::ImageConstPtr& msg
87  ){
88  cv::Mat frame;
89  try{
90  frame = cv_bridge::toCvCopy(msg, "mono8")->image;
91  } catch (cv_bridge::Exception &e){
92  ROS_ERROR("cv_bridge error: %s", e.what());
93  ROS_INFO("This node should be subscribed to a "
94  "topic producing grayscale (mono8) images");
95  }
96 
97  // I originally wanted to unwrap this and manually compute everything
98  // Ramsey uses cv::moments() to compute this but I'm unsure of the validity of
99  // this. I'll use it here to test it.
100  // He also applys a spectral trasform to the image that I'm unsure of
101  // spectrum = (np.round(((bgr[:,:,1] + bgr[:,:,2]) / bgr.sum(2).astype(float)) * 255.)).astype('uint8')
102  // Best I can tell this is taking an average of the blue and green channels
103  // and reducing this to a single "grey" channel.
104  cv::Moments frame_moments = cv::moments(frame);
105 
106  cv::Point centre_of_mass(
107  frame_moments.m10 / frame_moments.m00, // CoM x-coord
108  frame_moments.m01 / frame_moments.m00 // CoM y-coord
109  );
110 
111  // Because I can't be bothered fighting with CMake
112  const cv::Mat& frame_ref = frame;
113  Cue cv_cue(centre_of_mass, frame_ref);
114 
115  if (this->video){
116  cv::Mat &colour_frame = cv_cue.drawCueVectorOnFrame(frame);
117  bb_util::vision::imshow("Centroid Vector", colour_frame);
118  }
119 
120  this->pub.publish(cv_cue.toMessage());
121 }
